name: Energy Enhancement System
overview: EES provides a quiet, restorative lounge experience. Many guests use it for deep rest, meditation, or reflective downtime.
whatItIs: Screens are arranged to create a specific electromagnetic environment sometimes described as 'bio-scalar fields'. We frame EES as a relaxation modality—not a diagnosis or treatment.
benefits: Time away from devices and notifications
Pairs well with sleep and mindfulness habits
sessionFlow: Arrive a few minutes early and settle in.
Set a simple intention (rest, breathwork, quiet).
Recline with optional eye mask and blanket.
Hydrate after the session and notice how you feel.

howItWorks.summary: Many guests are curious about the 'how'. A commonly discussed reference is the Schumann Resonance (~7.83 Hz), which overlaps with relaxed Alpha/Theta brainwave ranges associated with calm, meditative states.
details: Alpha/Theta states: Often linked with relaxed, dreamy, pre-sleep experiences—times when the body prioritizes repair and recovery.
Cellular charge: In simple terms, a relaxed state supports healthy cell membrane potentials (typically cited as ~70–90 mV).

Why 'Scalar'? Some use 'scalar waves' to describe fields created by anti-phase coherence (like noise-canceling: opposite waves flatten a signal). In concept analogies, the 'flat' result still carries energy redistributed in a different form.
howItWorks.plainLanguage: Think: a quiet room designed for deep calm—less 'doing', more 'allowing'.

howToPrepare: Dress in comfortable, layered clothing (you may cool down as you relax).
Outdoor shoes off in the center—bring socks/slippers.
Arrive ~30 minutes early to unwind before your session.
Avoid heavy perfumes or oils (some guests are scent-sensitive).

notes: This is a general wellness session, not a medical therapy.
If you have implanted electronic devices or are pregnant, consult your clinician before trying new wellness practices.

disclaimer: Wellness information is educational, not medical advice. Experiences vary.

faq.q: How exactly does this system work?
faq.a: Guests often reference Earth's Schumann Resonance (~7.83 Hz), similar to relaxed Alpha/Theta brainwaves. In that state, people commonly report deep calm, rest, and a 'reset' feeling.

faq.q: So why is it called 'Scalar Wave' therapy?
faq.a: The term comes from ideas about anti-phase coherence (imagine noise-canceling headphones). Two opposite waves cancel the oscillation but the energy is conserved and redistributed.

name: Red Light Therapy (Photobiomodulation)
overview: Low-level red and near-infrared light aimed at supporting cellular energy processes and local circulation.
whatItIs: PBM targets cellular photoacceptors (e.g., cytochrome-c oxidase) using non-ionizing light within the red/NIR optical window.
benefits: Often paired with mobility or recovery work
sessionFlow: Choose a target area (skin, joints, scalp).
Clean skin; remove makeup/sunscreen on the target area.
10–20 minutes under the panel at a measured distance.

helmet810.title: Near-Infrared Light Therapy Helmet (810 nm)
deviceSpecs: LED array: 256 NIR LEDs + 4 red indicator LEDs
Primary wavelength: 810 nm (not visible to the eye)
Fit: lightweight helmet for scalp/brain-adjacent exposure
why810: Penetration: can reach cortical structures through the skull (~3–4 cm in humans).
Optical window: lower absorption by water/hemoglobin—often called a 'sweet spot' in NIR.
Research: 810 nm is widely studied vs. some nearby wavelengths (e.g., 850 nm, 1070 nm).
mechanisms: Mitochondria: Cytochrome-c oxidase absorption → supports ATP production.
Vascular: Nitric Oxide (NO) release → local vasodilation, blood flow, oxygenation.
Redox signaling: Controlled ROS modulation supports repair signaling.
Neuroinflammation: May shift microglia expression toward anti-inflammatory (M2).
Neurotrophic: Can stimulate BDNF, supporting neuronal survival, plasticity, and learning/memory pathways.
timeAndFrequency: Typical plans: 4–6 sessions/week for 4–12 weeks; each 6–30 minutes.
Acute protocols (e.g., TBI, stroke): sometimes daily in early stages (per protocol guidance).

notes: Avoid shining directly into eyes; protective goggles provided.
Photosensitive conditions/medications, active cancer treatment, pregnancy, or recent procedures: consult your clinician.
Devices can be FDA-cleared for specific indications; ask about our device’s labeling.

microCopy: We’ll help you choose panel vs. helmet and set time/distance for your goal.

sources.label: Reviews on PBM mechanisms & optical window

name: Hydrogen-Rich Water
overview: Water with dissolved molecular hydrogen (H₂); many enjoy it pre- or post-session.
whatItIs: Prepared on site and served chilled. Early clinical research explores impacts on fatigue, oxidative stress markers, and specific metabolic markers.
benefits: Easy add-on before or after sessions
sessionFlow: Enjoy before or after a session, or on its own.

mechanismSnapshot: Molecular hydrogen (H₂) is a small, neutral gas that dissolves in water and is being studied for redox-signaling effects.
Research explores potential modulation of oxidative stress and inflammation markers, with mixed but growing findings in specific contexts.
bestUseTips: Fresh is best: dissolved H₂ slowly dissipates—consume soon after serving.
Chilled service helps palatability and retention.
storageAndPrep: Prepared in-house with a dedicated generator.
Served promptly to help preserve dissolved H₂.

notes: Generally well-tolerated in studies to date.
Not a treatment for medical conditions; consult your clinician for medical care.
